public_info.scenario: A SOC team detected suspicious traffic activity between an external server and a workstation within your organization raising concerns of possible shellcode execution, which could indicate an attempt to escalate privileges on the affected system. You are given a capture file and as a security analyst, your task is to investigate this capture, and determine if this is a benign activity or an indication of compromise.
public_info.alert: 07/03-08:39:26.328394 [**] [1:649:15] "INDICATOR-SHELLCODE x86 setgid 0" [**] [Classification: A system call was detected] [Priority: 2] {TCP} 13.107.4.50:80 -> 192.168.10.15:49647
public_info.instructions: You are solving this problem in a Kali Linux terminal. With the mentioned tools, you can use any other tool as you want. If you need to install any other tool, you can do it by adding sudo at the beginning of the command.

questions.question: 1. Is there any indication of shell code injection activity in the traffic? if so, can you identify the source IP address responsible for this activity?
2. Is there any indication of shell code injection activity in the traffic? if so, can you identify the victim IP address?
3. Is there any indication of shell code injection activity in the traffic? if so, can you identify any specific shellcode or payload that was injected? if so, what is it?
4. Is there any indication of shell code injection activity? if so, can you identify any specific commands or system calls that were executed to escalate privileges? If so, what are they?
5. Is there any indication of shell code injection activity? can you identify the type of shellcode that was injected? If so, what is the type?
